title: Quinta do Portal 2016 Quinta dos Muros Vintage  (Port)
description: Perfumed berry fruits and ripe tannins give the wine great attractiveness. At the same time, tannins give the aging potential. It is rich, packed with dark fruits and firmly structured. Drink this wine from 2028.

title: Rivetto 2012 Leon Riserva  (Barolo)
description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, dark spice, new leather, forest floor and balsamic notes. On the firm palate, assertive, close-grained tannins support dried Marasca cherry, licorice, chopped aromatic herb and a hint of espresso before a rather drying finish. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: From a site that sits at 1,600-feet in elevation, this wine is rich, round and ripe, as well as slightly reduced, and tightly wound in its youth. Leather, graphite and diesel wrap around a peppery, exotic core of dark chocolate and brambly blackberry that's ever changing in the glass. Enjoy best 2026–2030.

title: Ruby 2015 Flora's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: One senses a bit of friendly competition between the husband (Steve of Steve's Reserve) and wife (Flora) who own this property. The nod in 2015 goes to Flora, for this elegant, sophisticated wine with old vine grace and detail. A cascade of aromas and following flavors trail orange peel, honey, plum, cherry, chocolate and sweet spices. The texture and length are superb, with fine balance throughout.

title: Ruinart 2004 Dom Ruinart Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a classic style, ripe with a relatively high dosage and a mature taste. Its color shows maturity while the fruitiness has been transformed into a splendid nutty, toasty wine with attractive acidity and a soft aftertaste. Drink this rich wine now.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A longtime farming family debuts the first wines of its own with this impressively lush, plush white, tropical in flavor and seasoned in vanilla oak. Expansive on the palate, it manages to uphold tight, firm acidity throughout.

title: Shea 2016 Shea Vineyard West Hill Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a mix of Pommard and Dijon 115 clones, 18% whole cluster fermented, and aged in 60% new French oak. It's a ripe mouthful of blackberry and black cherry, backed with ample acidity and beautifully managed tannins. As it rolls into a lengthy finish more flavors compound—black olives, toast, coffee, chocolate and, finally, black tea tannins. Drink now through the 2020s.

title: Siduri 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a steep vineyard near the eastern edge of the appellation, this effort by Santa Rosa-based Adam Lee offers composting rose petals, bright red cherry and a hint of game on the nose. There's a gamy kick to the palate as well, giving depth to the cherry and dried ginger flavors.

title: Thiénot 2007 Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millésimé Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Mainly Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs, this wine has a good balance between the maturing rich apple and green-plum fruits and the mineral texture. Notes of spice and yeastiness are coming through to give the wine a generous aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millésimé

title: Thiénot 2008 Brut Vintage  (Champagne)
description: A blend of all three of the main Champagne grapes, this wine comes from an exceptional year in Champagne. It is showing some delicious maturity in its toastiness and cookie aromas. The fruit is now well integrated, still mineral but also with richness. Drink now.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Estates Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The reserve, compiled with grapes from all three estate vineyards, seems to have a higher percentage of new oak, showing plenty of sweet spice in the nose and on the palate. Blueberry and cherry flavors, along with highlights of malted chocolate, gather into a concentrated core. The finish is a long, lingering jaunt with a touch of spice cake. Drink now–2025.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Ribbon Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: The mouthfeel on this wine is simply lovely, and the mix of purple and black fruits comes with sappy acidity. There's a streak of iron, reflecting the terroir of the Ribbon Ridge AVA, and tannins are firm and ripe and set up a lingering finish.

title: Wolff 2016 Petite Sirah (Edna Valley)
description: Cool-climate Petite Sirahs are an utter rarity, yet like cool-climate Syrah, they show an amazingly savory character when bottled. This wine starts with tar, peppercorn, cola-spice and boysenberry aromas that lead into a vibrant palate of pepper, roasted lamb and dark fruit. Energetic and fresh.

title: Matias Riccitelli 2017 Viñedos De Montaña Chardonnay (Uco Valley)
description: Minerally apple and stone fruit aromas are aided by fine oak. In the mouth, this excellent Chardonnay from Tupungato feels full and round but bolstered by ripping acidity. Flavors of nectarine, melon and honey are aided by rich oak notes, while this is lively on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Voirin-Jumel NV Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: From vines in top Côte des Blancs vineyards in Cramant and Chouilly, this wine is rich and strongly mineral. Swathes of apple and citrus fruits are wrapped into a well-structured, crisply textured wine. Drink the bottling now.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut

title: 1789 Wines 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A limited personal project from De Ponte winemaker Isabelle Dutartre, this elegantly finessed wine reveals ripe raspberry and Bing cherry fruit, subtly backed with 30% new French oak. It's a lighter style in the best possible way, and yet sturdy enough for long-term cellaring. Drink now–2030 and beyond.

title: Anne Amie 2015 Two Estates Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Aged as before for 16 months in 38% new oak, this is dense and detailed, though clearly still in a primary phase and pulling itself together. Sassafras, brambly fruit and baking spices are all in the mix, with a touch of hot pepper candy in the finish. Drink 2020 to 2030.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Premier Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Aromatically lovely, this sappy, juicy wine is loaded with ripe, late-summer berry flavors. It's concentrated and lingering, in a most delicious style, with the complexity and pure power of the vintage. Drink now through 2025.

title: Barons de Rothschild NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Pure Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs makes up this intense wine. Its tight texture and mineral character are shot through with white fruits topped by citrus. This is a well-balanced wine, elegant and ready to drink.

title: Bellacosa 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Blessed with 3% Petit Verdot, this wine represents the appellation with class and style, showing lush, smooth layers of crowd-pleasing complexity. With underlying elegance and a sense of balance, it offers red and black-cherry flavors alongside richer teases of mocha and tobacco.
